author: Staff Reporter
text:
All -out efforts:A signature campaign, as part of the voter awareness programme, was organised in Thoothukudi Collectorate on Thursday. — Photo: N. Rajesh.

Collector and District Election Officer M. Ravikumar here on Thursday flagged off a video van belonging to the Department of Information and Public Relations to screen awareness videos urging voters to exercise their franchise in the upcoming Assembly election. The van would screen videos in public places and other key locations.

Videos involving actors and familiar sports personalities, appealing to voters to exercise their franchise as voting is their democratic right and stressing the fact that voters should not take money to vote, were screened.

Besides, a signature campaign was kick-started by the Collector on the Collectorate premises to ensure hundred percent polling in the upcoming polls.

Apart from these programmes, students also took an oath to vote, as it was their basic democratic right. Thoothukudi Sub Collector and Returning Officer S. Gopala Sundara Raj inaugurated the programme organised at Subbiah Vidyalayam Girls Higher Secondary School here. The students were also provided with oath pamphlets highlighting the need for voter awareness. The students were asked to obtain signatures of their parents on the pamphlets after reading it. Such awareness pamphlets were given to 35, 000 students. Of the 2,75,218 electorate in Thoothukudi Assembly constituency, around 70,000 voters were parents, the Sub Collector said. Chief Educational Officer M. Ramakrishnan, Assistant Headmistress of the school Vasuki were present.
title: Video van flagged off to spread the word on voting
